titles.en: THE BOOK OF OATHS, AND THE VOWS, AND THE EXPIATIONS

titles.ar: باب كَرَاهِيَةِ الْيَمِينِ بِالْبَرَاءَةِ مِنَ اللَّهِ وَ رَسُولِهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله )
titles.en: Chapter 5 – Abhorrence for (swearing of) the oath with the disavowing from Allah<sup>azwj</sup> and His<sup>azwj</sup> Rasool<sup>saww</sup>

titles.ar: باب أَنَّهُ لَا يُحْلَفُ إِلَّا بِاللَّهِ وَ مَنْ لَمْ يَرْضَ [بِاللَّهِ] فَلَيْسَ مِنَ اللَّهِ
titles.en: Chapter 4 – There is no swearing except by Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, and the one who is not pleased with Allah<sup>azwj</sup>, so is not from Allah<sup>azwj</sup>

titles.ar: كِتَابُ الْأَيْمَانِ وَ النُّذُورِ وَ الْكَفَّارَاتِ
titles.en: THE BOOK OF OATHS, AND THE VOWS, AND THE EXPIATIONS

titles.ar: باب كَرَاهِيَةِ الْيَمِينِ بِالْبَرَاءَةِ مِنَ اللَّهِ وَ رَسُولِهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله )
titles.en: Chapter 5 – Abhorrence for (swearing of) the oath with the disavowing from Allah<sup>azwj</sup> and His<sup>azwj</sup> Rasool<sup>saww</sup>

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: حسن - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (24/313)

narrator_chain.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ أَبِيهِ عَنِ ابْنِ أَبِي عُمَيْرٍ رَفَعَهُ قَالَ

text: سَمِعَ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) رَجُلًا يَقُولُ أَنَا بَرِي‏ءٌ مِنْ دِينِ مُحَمَّدٍ فَقَالَ لَهُ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) وَيْلَكَ إِذَا بَرِئْتَ مِنْ دِينِ مُحَمَّدٍ فَعَلَى دِينِ مَنْ تَكُونُ قَالَ فَمَا كَلَّمَهُ رَسُولُ اللَّهِ ( صلى الله عليه وآله ) حَتَّى مَاتَ .

en.hubeali: Ali Bin Ibrahim, from his father, from Ibn Abu Umeyr, raising it, said, ‘Rasool-Allah saww heard a man saying,

‘I disavow from the Religion of Muhammad<sup>saww</sup>’. So Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> said to him: ‘Woe be unto you! When you disavow from the Religion of Muhammad<sup>saww</sup>, so upon whose Religion would you happen to be?’ He<sup>asws</sup> said: ‘So Rasool-Allah<sup>saww</sup> had not spoken to him, until (immediately) he died’.
en.sarwar: 1. Ali ibn Ibrahim has narrated from his father from ibn abu ‘Umayr from in a marfu‘ manner who has narrated the following: “The Messenger of Allah, O Allah, grant compensation to Muhammad and his family worthy of their services to Your cause, once heard a man saying, T disown the religion of Muhammad.’ The Messenger of Allah, O Allah, grant compensation to Muhammad and his family worthy of their services to Your cause, then asked saying, ‘Woe is upon you, if you are not a follower of the religion of Muhammad, then whose religion do you follow?’ He (the Imam) has said that as soon as the words of the Messenger of Allah, O Allah, grant compensation to Muhammad and his family worthy of their services to Your cause, were complete, he (the man) dropped dead.’”

gradings: Allamah Baqir al-Majlisi: ضعيف - Mir‘at al ‘Uqul Fi Sharh Akhbar Al al Rasul (24/313)

narrator_chain.text: مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحُسَيْنِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنْ صَالِحِ بْنِ عُقْبَةَ عَنْ يُونُسَ بْنِ ظَبْيَانَ قَالَ

text: قَالَ لِي يَا يُونُسُ لَا تَحْلِفْ بِالْبَرَاءَةِ مِنَّا فَإِنَّهُ مَنْ حَلَفَ بِالْبَرَاءَةِ مِنَّا صَادِقاً أَوْ كَاذِباً فَقَدْ بَرِئَ مِنَّا .

en.hubeali: Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Muhammad Bin Al Husayn, from Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Salih Bin Uqba, from Yunus Bin Zabyan who said,

‘He<sup>asws</sup> said to me: ‘O Yunus! Do not swear an oath with the disavowing (giving up/rejecting) from us<sup>asws</sup>, for the one who swear with the disavowing from us<sup>asws</sup>, truly or falsely, so he is disavowed (rejected) from us<sup>asws</sup>’.
en.sarwar: 2. Muhammad ibn Yahya has narrated from Muhammad ibn al-Husayn from Muhammad ibn ’Isma‘il from Salih ibn ‘Uqbah from Yunus ibn Zabayan who has narrated the following: “He (the Imam), ‘Alayhi al-Salam, said to me, ‘O Yunus, do not swear to disown us, because if one does so, true or false, he is cut off from us.’”
